name: The Ritz Carlton Half Moon Bay

reviews.text: The Ritz-Carlton in Half Moon Bay sits on the shoreline. The views from this location are spectacular. We were there for a conference for a couple of days, and wish we could have spent more time at this hotel. Service from the staff was at five star level. Here's hoping you get the opportunity to stay at the Ritz-Carlton - Half Moon Bay,
reviews.title: Beautiful Place To Stay!
Great views, good service, nice rooms
reviews.text: Very nice location along cliffs just south of the town of Half Moon Bay. The service is very good. Check in could use a bit more staff during the busy times but they do have a nice can do attitude at the front desk. The common areas are a bit small but are adequate. The gym is open 24 hours a day and is nicely equipped with views of the ocean. The outdoor fire pits are really very nice, it seems that it is always pretty cool here with wind. So bring warm clothes. Just the fact that there is no outdoor pool suggest too cold to be outside swimming. The spa is nice with very nice locker rooms, steam bath, cool and hot plunge pools and nice common area with a large hot tub. The food is pricy but very good. Overall, the views are spectacular, common areas fantastic, food and service excellent, the rooms are a bit pricy but you are paying for the location. Compared to other Ritz Carlton properties, this one is nicer but pricier!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I got the romance package for $790 for a night. Way too much money. Just get their cheapest room. The hotel is very nice. Service was great. The room was fine. The beach/cliffs were cool. Their patio excellent. But, the value wasn't there. I thought the breakfast was OK at best, but it was a fortune. $6.50 for a glass of generic OJ (not fresh squeezed)? That says it all. The atmosphere was good though. Perfect for a night away. The best part was my morning run along the seaside cliffs. That was cool. And yes, it is cold.
reviews.title: I agree with the feedback - nice but overpriced
Beautiful Views a nice place to relax
reviews.text: My boyfriend finished off a 10 day California trip with 3 nights at Half Moon Bay. We ended up arriving a day early and they were very accomodating and had a room available for us.

We had reserved a ocean front fire pit room and it was lovely. We spent hours relaxing in the sun, watching the golfers and the crashing waves. One thing to remember, it is a family "resort" and there were lots of children. Normally we don't have any problems with children but the lack of parental supervision was shocking. Kids on scooters, zipping around the bar and patio area where people are trying to relax and enjoy a drink and the view and the parents totally ignoring what was going on. Certainly not the hotels fault just a lack of common courtesy when you have spent $500-600/night. We did a wine tasting and enjoyed dinner some jazz, the stunning views and loved the bag piper who appeard at dusk.
reviews.title: Cheezy Motel Room with nice view for 1,200 a night!

reviews.text: Having stayed at the Ritz Carlton in Toronto 2 weeks before, the Ritz in Half Moon Bay was shabby and slightly run down in comparison. Location is great, overlooking the sea. My room was nice enough - not fantastic. Bed was very soft, which I don't particularly like. Would I dash back here? No, unlikely.
reviews.title: I wasn't blown away

reviews.text: Staying at the resort was such a treat. Rooms are elegant, quite and clean. The view from the property is stunning. I enjoyed having cocktails outside by the firepit looking out over the bay at sunset. Staff is as expected at the Ritz Carlton, friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Fabulous Resort!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The draw back with the hotel is that it is pretty isolated and food is very expensive. A hamburger and 2 beers was $30. Room service breakfast for one, $51.
reviews.title: Great Vacation Spot

reviews.text: It was unfortunate that I arrived as Mother's Day Brunch guests were leaving. It took 20 minutes just to get 100 yards to the valet. Also had to tell 3 people directing traffic, I was checking in.
reviews.title: Full Moons at Half Moon Bay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was one of the finest hotels I've stayed in (and I am a frequent traveler). From check-in to checkout, I was treated as an honored guest. Everything I needed was provided. The hotel itself is beautiful, with excellent amenities and a caring staff. I couldn't be happier with my experience.
reviews.title: Breathtaking Views!

reviews.text: We visited the Ritz Carlton Half Moon bay with my husband and 5 year old twin children over Easter.
reviews.title: Breathtaking but recommended for couples only!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As we pulled up into the drive way I was not struck by it being anything special, it looked a little like a smart old peoples home on a golf course with a series of identikit houses facing it across the road. One of the our twins threw up however and the lady at the barrier was extremely helpful even insisting on taking his dirty sick bag from me and that level of keen to please no matter what service carried on throughout our stay which helped to justify its expense. After we walked inside and had a view of the back of the hotel my idea of its mediocracy evaporated. The cliff top vista of the raging Pacific Ocean below was one of the most romantic views I have ever seen. It really is jaw dropping.
reviews.title: Decent service, but amazing views

reviews.text: The food at the hotel was excellent as was the spa and its treatments. I had massages by 3 different people and all three were great. The Sunday brunch is raved about and many drive up from San Francisco for it I was expecting a lot therefore but was disappointed. It was nothing special and the e al a cart menu was much better.
reviews.title: Romantic but can b cold

reviews.text: The indoor swimming pool is old and looks like it is housed in a horrible green house-definately needs renewing and the children's club is one smallish room and was being used as storage for a jewellery sale. There were tennis courts and lessons could be arranged for both children and adults. All in all there is not much to do apart from play golf and I would not recommend the hotel for children. It is definitely a hotel for golfers, couples or parents of babies who need a break as a young family. There is not too much to do for older children.
reviews.title: A treat for a special event
Phenomenal service and facilities
reviews.text: The high point of staying at this hotel is snuggling under a blanket outside at sunset next to one of the outdoor fire pits and having a hot drink from 'The Chocolate Bar' whilst listening to the resident bagpiper playing Amazing Grace while a local eagle soars above your head as the sun sinks into the Pacific Ocean. That is a memory I will never forget!

reviews.title: Take a walk, have a drink at the fire pit, and visit--even if you are not over overnighting here
reviews.text: This is a great property to spend a weekend, but even if you are heading elsewhere up or down the coast, visit here for an hour or two. Take a walk, then enjoy the spectacular scenery from the adirondack chairs at the outdoor lounge and order a hot toddy! Watch the golfers, and ask for a blanket if it gets windy by the fire pit. Ritz always delivers.

This was the perfect storm of PERFECTION! Granted the perfect weather was really rare on the weekend we were there for a wedding, no fog & not cold, only needed a light sweater on our stroll on the golf course path down to a sheltered beach. We watched the rugged coast at an early dinner by the window. My husband said it was the best Swordfish he has ever had. Our server Molly was delightful. Cuddled up in provided blankets by the fire pit enjoying the breathtaking evening, wine & listening to bagpiper. Could have been in Scotland or on the 17 Mile Drive! Other reviewers have said it was like a palace but we found it warm, welcoming, not pretentious at all, more like a large mansion. We've been fortunate to have stayed at other Ritz Carlton properties and this is definitely our favorite. Loved it! We will be back!
reviews.title: Stunning vistas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Ritz-Carlton for two nights earlier this month as part of a last-minute staycation (as we live in SF). We settled on an ocean view room with a private fire pit and drove on down.
reviews.title: Lovely setting, overpriced hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room itself is small - only about 450 square feet - and somewhat underwhelming for the very expensive ($800/night) price tag that accompanied it. The outdoor fire pit was great, though, with lovely views of Half Moon Bay. We could see the bagpiper play and the fog rolling in off the ocean. It was gorgeous and relaxing.
reviews.title: Just stopped in for breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food on property is good quality but terribly over-priced; dinner in their fancy restaurant failed to impress. Breakfast was nice - we elected to skip the brunch and just eat in the Conservatory. They have a daily buffet but you can also do a la carte, which we preferred. I was annoyed that the first day we went to check in for breakfast, we were told there was a wait for tables, even though we could clearly see open tables. I inquired as to why we couldn't be seated at one of the open tables and was told they were for other people; 10 minutes later, we we seated at... one of the open tables I had inquired about.
reviews.title: What happened to the Yoga Room?

aka: The Ritz Carlton Half Moon Bay Hotel
description: The Ritz-Carlton, Half Moon Bay, an elite golf and spa resort hotel. With two distinct guest room experiences from the guest houses to our main building, the hotel combines the beauty of the Northern California coast with the history of old Scotland.
